doc.previous: Tufts are applied to a model and remain attached during testing. Tufts can be used to gauge air flow patterns and flow separation.
doc.after: Evaporating suspensions are simply a mixture of some sort or fine powder, talc, or clay mixed into a liquid with a low latent heat of evaporation. When the wind is turned on the liquid quickly evaporates leaving behind the clay in a pattern characteristic of the air flow.
